headline: Taiwan raids former TSMC exec's homes in trade secrets probe
summary: STORY: Taiwan prosecutors said on Thursday investigators had raided the homes of a former senior TSMC executive and seized computers, after the company accused him of leaking trade secrets, which his current employer Intel has denied.TSMC said on Tuesday it had filed a lawsuit in Taiwan's Intellectual Property and Commercial Court against Wei-Jen Lo, its former senior vice president.:: SET TVTSMC is the world's largest contract chipmaker and major supplier to companies including Nvidia.:: TSMCTaiwan prosecutors' intellectual property branch said in a statement Lo is suspected of violating Taiwan's National Security Act.Lo did not immediately respond to a Reuters request for comment.:: Intel CorporationEarlier on Thursday, U.S. chipmaker Intel said in an emailed statement; "Based on everything we know, we have no reason to believe there is any merit to the allegations involving Mr Lo."Lo, helped drive TSMC's mass production of cutting-edge chips in a 21-year-long career there.Before that Lo was at Intel for 18 years. He re-joined Intel in October after retiring from TSMC.

headline: Intel--TSMC Trade?Secret Bombshell Erupts Just as Nvidia Earnings Hit the Spotlight
summary: A high-stakes legal fight over a star engineer lands at the exact moment the chip sector braces for Nvidia's next move.

headline: Intel Rejects TSMC Allegations of Trade-Secret Leak by New Executive
summary: Chipmaker denies wrongdoing after rival files lawsuit in Taiwan.

raw.headline: Intel Rejects TSMC Allegations of Trade-Secret Leak by New Executive
raw.summary: Chipmaker denies wrongdoing after rival files lawsuit in Taiwan.

headline: Intel Executive’s Home Raided in Taiwan Criminal Probe Over National Secrets
summary: Wei-Jen Lo’s previous employer, TSMC, says he violated noncompete and confidentiality agreements when he joined rival Intel.

raw.headline: Intel Executive’s Home Raided in Taiwan Criminal Probe Over National Secrets
raw.summary: Wei-Jen Lo’s previous employer, TSMC, says he violated noncompete and confidentiality agreements when he joined rival Intel.

headline: Taiwan raids former TSMC exec's home in trade secrets probe
summary: TAIPEI (Reuters) -Taiwan prosecutors said on Thursday investigators had raided the homes of a former senior TSMC executive and ​seized computers after the company accused him of leaking trade secrets, something his ‌current employer Intel has denied.  TSMC , the world's largest contract chipmaker and major supplier to companies including Nvidia, ‌said on Tuesday it had filed a lawsuit in Taiwan's Intellectual Property and Commercial Court against Wei-Jen Lo, its former senior vice president.
